did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Grayson County (Va.) Superior Court of Law Records, 1809-1833
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Grayson County (Va.) Superior Court of Law Records, 1809-1833. Local government records collection, Grayson County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Th1s item came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Grayson County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Grayson County was named for William Grayson, a delegate to the Continental Congress from 1784 to 1787 and one of the first two United States senators from Virginia. It was formed from Wythe County in 1792, and a part of Patrick County was added in 1810.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Grayson County (Va.) Superior Court of Law Records, 1809-1833, contains Fee Book, 1809-1833.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Grayson County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"
